column1: What's the difference between AC and DC?

Diode: Positive to negative
column3: Opposite of electron flow (negative to positive)

Diode: Reference point for voltage (0V). Also safety connection to Earth.
column3: Like sea level for elevation. Everything measured relative to it.

Diode: Which terminal is positive vs negative

Diode: Components connected end-to-end (single path)

Diode: Components connected side-by-side (multiple paths)
column3: Voltage same across all. Currents add.

Diode: Low/zero resistance path (usually accidental)

Diode: Infinite resistance - broken/disconnected path

Diode: Stores charge, blocks DC, passes AC

Diode: Stores energy in magnetic field, resists current changes
column3: Like flywheel - opposes changes in current

Diode: Allows current in ONE direction only

Diode: Amplifies signal OR acts as electronic switch

Diode: AC version of resistance (includes capacitance/inductance effects)

I am busy (or I am busy with _________). Are you busy?

Decrease power. Shall I decrease power?

(1. Nil; 2. Slightly; 3. Moderately; 4. Severely; 5. Extremely.)
Is my transmission being interfered with?

Diode: All frequencies, all modes, all power

Diode: Star topology with relay nodes (like WiFi repeaters)

Diode: Yes - limited privileges on 10m (28.000-28.500 MHz)

Diode: 200W PEP (VHF/UHF), 200W PEP (10m), 1500W on other HF if upgraded

Diode: Drone behavior when control signal lost
column3: Typically hovers, lands, or returns home (configurable)

Diode: IMU (gyroscope/accelerometer) to keep camera level
column3: Allows smooth video in wind/motion

Diode: Remote Pilot in Command - responsible person during flight
column3: Holds Part 107 cert, makes all decisions

Diode: Person assisting PIC by maintaining visual contact with drone
column3: Optional but helpful. Must communicate with PIC.

Diode: Can be someone other than PIC, but PIC remains responsible
column3: PIC supervises, holds cert

column1: Can VO use binoculars for VLOS?
Diode: NO - VLOS must be unaided eye
column3: Binoculars OK to supplement but not replace unaided vision

Diode: Unmanned aircraft <55 lbs
column3: Includes drone + payload

Diode: All drones 0.55 lbs to 55 lbs must be registered
column3: $5, valid 3 years, mark drone with number

Diode: Externally visible OR inside battery compartment (with tool access)
column3: FAA now allows internal marking

Diode: Serious injury OR property damage >$500 (not drone itself)
column3: Report within 10 days to FAA

Diode: Hospitalization >48 hours (within 7 days of injury), bone fracture, laceration with nerve damage
column3: Not just cuts/bruises

column1: Can you fly in national parks?
Diode: NO - National Park Service bans drones
column3: Some exceptions for official use with permit

Diode: Manned aircraft ALWAYS have right of way over drones
column3: If you see aircraft, descend and move away immediately

Diode: Can deviate from Part 107 if necessary for safety
column3: Must report deviation to FAA if requested

Diode: Small Unmanned Aircraft System - drone + controller + links
column3: Includes all components of system

Diode: Effective communication and teamwork among crew (PIC, VO, etc.)
column3: Speak up if you see safety issue

Diode: Systematic approach to risk assessment and decision making
column3: PAVE: Pilot, Aircraft, Environment, External pressures

Diode: 1200 ft AGL (or 700 ft near airports)
column3: Below this = uncontrolled

Diode: 700-1200 ft AGL (varies)
column3: Above Class G, below Class A

Diode: Surface to 10,000 ft MSL (varies by airport)
column3: Busiest airspace

Diode: Surface to 2500 ft AGL, 4-5 nm radius
column3: Towered airport

Diode: 400 ft AGL
column3: Can go higher near tall structures (within 400ft of structure)

Diode: Surface to 3000 ft AGL
column3: 1 nm radius
Irrelevant for drones

Diode: Temperature increases with altitude (opposite of normal)
column3: Traps pollutants, affects density altitude

Diode: Intense downdraft from thunderstorm, spreads on ground
column3: Extreme hazard - powerful winds, wind shear

Diode: Sudden change in wind speed/direction
column3: Can flip drone, very dangerous

Diode: Wind over obstacles, thermals, weather fronts, rotor from mountains
column3: Gusty winds = turbulence risk

Diode: Rising air from surface heating (thermals, thunderstorms)
column3: Unstable air, turbulence, can carry light drones

Diode: Afternoon, hot days, dark surfaces (pavement, plowed fields)
column3: Morning = calmer typically

Diode: Extreme turbulence, hail, lightning, microbursts, heavy rain
column3: Don't fly near or under thunderstorms. Ever.

Diode: Moisture freezing on aircraft
column3: Rare for low-altitude drones but can affect props/motors in winter

Diode: 30 minutes before sunrise to 30 minutes after sunset
column3: Civil twilight. Extended with anti-collision lights now.

Diode: Visible 3 statute miles, if flying twilight/night
column3: Flashing or steady, meets requirement

Diode: YES - some rules can be waived with FAA approval
column3: VLOS, operations over people, from moving vehicle - can request waiver

Diode: FAA DroneZone online portal
column3: Requires detailed safety case

Diode: Commercial = compensation/business. Recreational = hobby only.
column3: Recreational falls under Exception for Recreational Flyers

Diode: Must follow CBO guidelines, recreational only, <55 lbs, register if >0.55 lbs
column3: No test required for recreational

Diode: Community Based Organization (like AMA - Academy of Model Aeronautics)
column3: Recreational flyers must follow CBO safety guidelines

column1: Can you share footage from recreational flight?
Diode: YES - but can't be PAID for it
column3: YouTube ad revenue = gray area, direct payment = commercial

Diode: NO - public aircraft (police, fire, govt) have separate rules
column3: Part 107 is for civil (commercial/private) operations

column1: Part 107 altitude (400ft AGL) vs ham antenna height?
Diode: Both measured AGL (above ground level), not MSL
column3: Ham: higher = better. Drone: 400ft max.

Diode: Visual line of sight = must see with unaided eye (like ham radio horizon)
column3: Can't operate beyond visual range (like VHF line-of-sight)

column1: TFR is like ham radio forbidden frequencies?
Diode: Absolute prohibition - wildfire TFR = no ops (like restricted spectrum)
column3: Check NOTAMs like checking band plan

Diode: Automated approval system (like LAANC instant approval vs weeks for manual)
column3: Like API vs manual request process

column1: Sectional chart is like network diagram?
Diode: Visual map of airspace classes, airports, hazards
column3: Like topology map showing routers, subnets, firewalls

Diode: Security zones or permission levels
column3: Class B = most restricted, Class G = uncontrolled

column1: Weather minimums (3 SM, cloud clearance) are like?
Diode: Minimum viable conditions for operation
column3: Below minimums = unsafe, don't fly

column1: Density altitude effect on drone performance?
Diode: Hot/high/humid = reduced lift (same as aircraft performance)
column3: Thin air = less thrust, shorter flight time

Diode: Structured data format (270° at 15kt gusting 25kt)
column3: Parse like log files: direction, speed, gusts

Diode: Pre-deployment checklist (battery, props, links, GPS)
column3: Catch failures before they happen in production

Diode: Failsafe or exception handler (signal loss → RTH)
column3: Default safe behavior on error condition

Diode: Software-enforced boundaries (can't fly in restricted areas)
column3: Like firewall rules or access control

Diode: Device registration or MAC address tracking
column3: Unique ID for accountability

Diode: Incident response protocol (>$500 damage or hospitalization)
column3: Mandatory reporting for serious events

Diode: Root user or admin - ultimately responsible for all actions
column3: Can delegate control but not responsibility

column1: LiPo battery fire risk is like?
Diode: Runaway process or thermal throttling risk
column3: Damaged battery = catastrophic failure (fire/explosion)

Diode: Exhaust blast or output overflow
column3: 40+ mph downward airflow can injure bystanders

Diode: Process escaping control or runaway thread
column3: Set RTH as failsafe to recover

Diode: Secondary monitoring or redundancy
column3: Backup eyes, communicates with PIC

Diode: Priority queue or interrupt handling
column3: Manned aircraft = highest priority, always yield

Diode: Team communication protocols or agile standup
column3: Speak up if you see safety issue, regardless of hierarchy

Diode: Temporary resource lock during high-traffic event
column3: Exclusive airspace during game (like DB lock during transaction)

Diode: Critical system failure - no exceptions, immediate cessation
column3: 'If you fly, we can't' - grounds firefighting aircraft

Diode: Polling for system status before operation
column3: Check before EVERY flight (like health check before deployment)

column1: Daylight ops (30 min before sunrise to after sunset) is like?
Diode: Operating hours or scheduled maintenance window
column3: Extended with anti-collision lights (like extended support hours)

Diode: Exception request or policy override
column3: Request approval for operations outside standard rules

Diode: Production vs dev environment
column3: Recreational = hobby, commercial = business (requires cert)
